raw:
{
  "requirement_id": "001",
  "requirement_summary": "Comprehensive travel insurance for a 3-week trip to Europe for two travelers.",
  "detailed_description": "Customer requires comprehensive travel insurance covering various needs including medical coverage, trip cancellation, lost/delayed luggage, travel delay benefits, and specific accidental death benefits.",
  "travel_origin": "Singapore",
  "travel_destination": "Europe",
  "travel_duration": "3 weeks",
  "insurance_coverage_type": [
    "Comprehensive Medical Coverage",
    "Trip Cancellation",
    "Lost, Damaged, or Delayed Luggage",
    "Travel Delay Benefits"
  ],
  "pre_existing_conditions": [
    "High blood pressure"
  ],
  "medical_needs": [
    "Coverage for doctor visits",
    "Coverage for hospital stays"
  ],
  "activities_to_cover": [
    "Hiking"
  ],
  "age_group": "41-55",
  "additional_requests": "Double payout for accidental death occurring while using public transport.",
  "keywords": [
    "comprehensive cover",
    "medical coverage",
    "trip cancellation",
    "luggage cover",
    "travel delay",
    "hiking",
    "accidental death",
    "public transport"
  ]
}

json_dict.requirement_summary: Comprehensive travel insurance for a 3-week trip to Europe for two travelers.
json_dict.detailed_description: Customer requires comprehensive travel insurance covering various needs including medical coverage, trip cancellation, lost/delayed luggage, travel delay benefits, and specific accidental death benefits.
json_dict.additional_requests: Double payout for accidental death occurring while using public transport.

tasks_output.description:
Analyze the travel insurance call transcript below and extract key customer requirements.
Step 1: Read the transcript carefully and extract all relevant details. For each field in the schema, provide a brief annotation or reference to the specific portion(s) of the transcript where the detail was found.
Step 2: Review your annotations to verify that every extracted detail directly matches the transcript. Resolve any discrepancies or conflicts in the data.
Step 3: Produce a final, validated JSON object that adheres exactly to the TravelInsuranceRequirement schema

If a field is not mentioned in the transcript, use null.

Transcript:
Customer Service Agent: Good morning, thank you for calling ISS Insurance. My name is Sarah, how may I assist you today?
Customer: Yes, I need travel insurance. And make it quick, I don't have all day.
Customer Service Agent: Certainly. To help find the right information for you, could I start with a few details about your trip? Where will you be travelling from?
Customer: We're based in Singapore, obviously. That's why I'm calling ISS, isn't it?
Customer Service Agent: Of course. And where is your travel destination?
Customer: We're planning a trip to Europe. A proper tour.
Customer Service Agent: Europe, noted. And how long will you be away for?
Customer: It will be a 3 weeks trip.
Customer Service Agent: Thank you. And how many people will be travelling under this policy?
Customer: There will be 2 of us traveling. Both experienced travelers, I might add. I've been an ISS customer for years, you know. Home, car, the lot. So I expect good service.
Customer Service Agent: We appreciate your loyalty. Could I also ask the general age group of the travelers?
Customer: We're mostly around 41-55 years old. Fit and active.
Customer Service Agent: Okay, 41-55 age group. And regarding your trip to Europe, are there any specific activities you plan to participate in that might require specific mention, like adventure sports?
Customer: Look, we're not bungee jumping, but we plan to do some hiking. Nothing extreme, but if someone slips and needs medical attention for it, that absolutely has to be covered. No excuses.
Customer Service Agent: Alright, noted. Coverage for hiking activities. Are there any other specific activities?
Customer: No, just the hiking mainly. Sightseeing, relaxing. But things go wrong, don't they? What if our luggage gets lost or damaged? My suitcases are expensive, I expect proper reimbursement, not just a few dollars. And if it's delayed, I need to buy clothes immediately, that needs paying for.
Customer Service Agent: Understood. So, you require coverage for lost, damaged, or delayed baggage. Noted.
Customer: Yes, comprehensive cover. And medical is absolutely vital. One of us has high blood pressure – it's managed, but hospitals overseas are expensive. I expect any necessary doctor visits or hospital stays to be fully covered, no ifs or buts about pre-existing conditions. That's standard, right?
Customer Service Agent: Okay, I'm noting your requirement for comprehensive medical coverage, including considerations for doctor visits, hospital stays, and you've mentioned a pre-existing condition of high blood pressure.
Customer: Good. And what about delays? Flights get cancelled or delayed all the time. If we're stuck somewhere, I expect ISS to cover a decent hotel and meals until we can get moving again. Don't tell me I have to wait 12 hours or something ridiculous.
Customer Service Agent: Noted. You require cover for additional expenses like accommodation and meals due to significant travel delays.
Customer: Exactly. And trip cancellation too. If something serious happens – like illness, or a family emergency back home – and we have to cancel the whole thing, I need to know we'll get our money back for flights and hotels. No rubbish excuses.
Customer Service Agent: Okay, requirement for trip cancellation cover due to unforeseen covered reasons like illness or emergencies. Noted.
Customer: Right. Now, one very specific thing I saw mentioned with other insurers. I want to know if your policy offers double the payout for accidental death if, God forbid, it happens while travelling on public transport – like a train or a bus over there. That's a key requirement for me.
Customer Service Agent: Understood. You are specifically requesting confirmation on a benefit providing a double payout for accidental death occurring specifically while using public transport overseas. I have noted that requirement.
Customer: You better have. Look, my budget is flexible, but I expect top-tier coverage for everything I've mentioned. I don't want the basic package. Given my history with ISS, I expect this to be handled properly. If these requirements are a problem, I need to speak to someone senior right now.
Customer Service Agent: I understand your requirements clearly. Allow me to quickly summarize the key areas of coverage you need noted for your quote preparation. You require: Comprehensive Medical Coverage, with specific attention to pre-existing high blood pressure; coverage for Trip Cancellation; Lost, Damaged, or Delayed Luggage cover; Travel Delay benefits covering accommodation and meals; cover for injuries sustained during hiking activities; and crucially, the specific benefit of a double payout for accidental death occurring on public transport. Have I captured all your main requirements correctly?
Customer: Yes, that sounds about right. Make sure all of that is included when someone prepares the options. I don't want any nasty surprises in the fine print.
Customer Service Agent: Thank you for confirming. I have documented all these requirements. The next step is for our team to prepare travel insurance options based specifically on these needs for your 3-week trip to Europe for two travelers. Someone will be in touch with those details. Is there anything else I can note for you today?
Customer: No, that's it. Just get it done properly.
Customer Service Agent: Thank you for calling ISS Insurance. Have a good day.
Customer: Right. Bye.
tasks_output.expected_output: A JSON object that matches the TravelInsuranceRequirement model.
